text: Tuanku Syed Harun Putra ibni Almarhum Syed Hassan Jamalullail KCMG (Jawi) توانكو سيد هارون ڤوترا ابن المرحوم سيد حسن جمال الليل ;25 November 1920-16 April 2000) Was the Third Yang di-Pertuan Agong of Malaysia and the Sixth Raja of Perlis At that time, he was the longest reigning monarch in the world, a position he inherited from Franz Joseph II, Prince of Liechtenstein in 1989. == Early life == He was born in Arau, Perlis and was the son of Syed Hassan bin Syed Mahmud Jamalullail and Wan Teh binti Wan Endut on the 25th of November 1920. At the age of 20-21, he married Tengku Budriah binti Almarhum Tengku Ismail and 2 years later, had a son, Sirajuddin of Perlis, who is currently the Raja of Perlis now. == Raja of Perlis and Yang di-Pertuan Agong == In 1945 Syed Hamzah abdicated and Syed Putra was proclaimed the 6th Raja of Perlis.. In April 1960, he was installed as the Deputy Yang di-Pertuan Agong and in September, became the 3rd Yang di-Pertuan Agong of Malaysia. == Late life and Death == On the 20th September of 1965, Syed Putra, descended from the throne. He continued to be the Raja of Perlis until his death on 16 April 2000. Category:1920 births Category:2000 deaths Category:Knights Commander of the Order of St Michael and St George Category:Yang di-Pertuan Agong Category:Perlis
title: Putra of Perlis
